title: Resume
text:
Northampton, MA; 978-877-6257; erasmussen@umass.edu


R, ArcGIS (familiar with), Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook), Google Suites (Docs, Slides, Forms, Sheets)



University of Massachusetts Amherst, Amherst, MA Expected Graduation: May 2024
Master of Science in Data Analytics and Computational Social Sciences (Candidate)
Relevant Coursework: Data Science Fundamentals, Introduction to Quantitative Analysis, Survey Research Methods
Roger Williams University, Bristol, RI; May 2021
Bachelor of Science in Public Health; Double Major: Anthropology/Sociology; Minor: Biology
GPA: 3.949; Honors: Summa cum laude; Honors Program
2020 Academic Excellence Award in Anthropology/Sociology
2021 Thomas Sorger Award for Interdisciplinary Excellence in Public Health



Public Health Senior Capstone Fall 2020
“Increasing Staff Retention in the Disability Services Sector”

Identified public health problems at a human services organization and applied evidence-based research to make recommendations to reduce burnout and increase staff retention

Anthropology/Sociology Senior Thesis Spring 2020
“American Conceptions of Nutritional Health: A Cross-Cultural Comparison of Food-Based Dietary Guidelines”

Conducted a content analysis focusing on the effects of culture on nutrition recommendations
Awarded Thesis with Distinction




Fitzwilly’s, Northampton, MA, Server; June 2022- Present

Greeted guests, assisted customers using menu knowledge to inform orders and ensured customers had a good experience
Served parties of over twenty guests

Boston University School of Medicine, Framingham, MA, Research Assistant; October 2021- June 2022

Conducted research for the Brain Aging Program at the Framingham Heart Study
Reviewed participant medical charts scanning for evidence of cognitive decline and traumatic brain injuries
Recorded data from participant medical charts using REDcap

Rail Trail Flatbread Co., Hudson, MA, Server and Barback; September 2021- June 2022

Served guests and prepared beers, wines, and cocktails as a barback. Used judgement to prioritize tasks during busy periods
Assisted different areas of the restaurant as needed, including host stand, bussing, and food running
Attended bi-weekly server meetings and open book management classes to improve productivity as a team

Bolton Bean, Bolton MA, Barista; July 2020- October 2021

Prepared coffee and espresso beverages, took orders, assisted customers and helped train new staff

Seven Hills Foundation, Worcester, MA, Human Resources Intern; September 2020- December 2020

Performed administrative tasks such as filing employee records, helping with onboarding and new employee orientation, performing driving record checks, distributing staff awards, and completing employment verifications
Performed receptionist duties including directing visitors and phone calls and enforced COVID-19 sanitation procedures

Chartwells K-12 Dining Services, Newport, RI, Student Wellness Intern; September 2019- December 2019

Studied USDA requirements for school lunches, conducted interactive programs for students and their parents, served school lunch following portion requirements, created training presentation for Child and Adult Care Food Program, created a lunch preferences survey for students

Llandudno Pier, Llandudno, Wales, UK, Café Attendant and Bartender; June 2019- August 2019

Operated espresso machine to prepare coffee beverages, prepared food, cleaned, opened and closed café
Prepared and served alcoholic beverages, used judgement to appropriately card customers, cleaned bar facility

RWU Science Center,Bristol, RI, Biology and Chemistry Tutor; September 2018- September 2019

Assisted peers with homework, labs, and exam preparation
Taught students how to display data in Excel charts and graphs

RWU Health and Wellness Education, Bristol, RI, Health and Wellness Educator; August 2018- May 2019

Organized on-campus campaigns to promote healthy lifestyle and behavior choices for students
Created surveys and collected feedback to improve future programs
Trained by NIH-funded Peer Body Project researcher to facilitate small groups of women on the Peer Body Project to prevent eating disorders and promote positive body image at RWU

ALS Therapy Development Institute, Cambridge, MA, Tri-State Trek Intern; June 2018

Prepared for large scale bike event, took inventory, and marked course from Boston, MA to Greenwich, CT

title: About
text:
To work towards this passion, I am a current student in the Data Analytics and Computation Social Sciences (DACSS) program at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. I have an undergraduate degree in public health and anthropology/sociology. After completing my undergraduate degree I worked as a research assistant with the Framingham Heart Study which involved manually extracting data from individual health records. This led to my interest in the analysis portion of health data and making the process more efficient. I cannot wait to combine my interests to do meaningful work in public health data analysis in the future.
This blog has examples of my work from courses I have taken in my time at DACSS. Please feel free to browse my work, and do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
Emma Rasmussen
erasmussen@umass.edu
